short_summary: Required services of Senior Telecommunications Analyst  to provide support with DMOC for Simulation and Exercise branch of Royal Canadian Air Force
description: The Department of National Defence requires the professional services of one Senior Telecommunications Analyst to provide support with DMOC operations within and via the E&S-designed and operated Defence Secure Simulation and Training Node (DSSTNi) Information System (IS) also known as Shirley's Bay Campus in Ottawa.
full_summary:
================================================
### Solicitation Title
Telecommunications Analyst
================================================

### Solicitation Reference
(cb-7021-8554495)

### Originating Entity
National Defence

 Address:
51 Anson Ave, Bldg 518
 Astra, Ontario K0K 3W0
 Canada

### Contact Information
Leanne Cooper
(613) 392-2811 | leanne.cooper@forces.gc.ca

### Solicitation Overview
The Department of National Defence is seeking the professional services of a Senior Telecommunications Analyst to support Distributed Mission Operations Centre (DMOC) activities for the Exercise and Simulation (E&S) branch of the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) Aerospace Warfare Centre (AWC).

### Tender Specification
The successful bidder will provide technical support for DMOC operations within and via the Defence Secure Simulation and Training Node infrastructure Information System (IS). The bidder must have expertise in temporary personnel services with a strong understanding of telecommunications.

### Solicitation Details
* **Publication Date**: July 6, 2023
* **Closing Date**: July 21, 2023 at 14:00:00
* **Tender Method**: Competitive - Selective Tendering
* **Evaluation Criteria**: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price
* **Geographic Scope**: National Capital Region (NCR)
* **Industry Area**: Temporary personnel services (UNSPSC Code: 80111600)

### Notice Type
Request for Proposal (RFP) against Supply Arrangement

### Language of Tender
English and French

### Access to Solicitation Documents
 Click on the link below to access the tender documents:

 English: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7021/w6431-240114-ths_npp-eng.pdf
 French: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7021/w6431-240114-ths_npp-fr.pdf

Note: The original tender announcement document included a detailed business-friendly document (BSF document) at the end which, for the sake of this exercise, has been omitted. It would typically need to be left intact as such for those who want to participate in the RFP process. 

Last but not least, note that in some places I've re-arranged and/or rephrased your French descriptions (Suggestions are based on best translation so don't know if they may need re-review for precision) so be sure
